instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message:
No water damage, no obvious drops, tried two batteries, one of which is known-good. Any ideas where to start? ASD EFI shows no errors except the usual when the battery is low(sensor vb0r) which I know is normal.
Can't see any fried chips or anything.

<RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>(pp dcin in rush etc,) voltage steadily drops from around 16.7v downwards, thought it may have been a bad charge port board but i disconnected it and it still drops. The device charges normally, however. Or is it just the caps draining? Resistance to ground is around 300k then drops to 220k then goes back up slowly

two solderballs sticking out from <CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR>(<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_S0</SIGNAL>) - Resistance to ground 66.5ohm on pin 1.
Also, same with <CAPACITOR>C1060</CAPACITOR>(<SIGNAL>PPMAIN_IO_CPU</SIGNAL>) - resistance to ground [B].[/B]880k
both of these are in close proximity to cpu of course.

maybe some humidity or heat damage since some test points are slightly rainbow throughout the board. But no water drops or corrosion marks anywhere in housing or on board.

I will get more powerline measurements when I get back to my workshop:

voltages with fully charged battery only plugged in(no charger connected):
battery connector:
pin 1-3 ppvbat - 8.47v Diode mode - OL to ground***
pin 4 smbus smc 5 g3 scl - 3.416v diode mode - .5v to ground
pin 5 smc sda - 3.416v Diode mode - .5v to ground
pin 6 - sys detect l - OL Diode mode - OL to ground - Resistance is 9.94k(<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> ok)
pin 7-9 ground diode mode 0v obv

still only battery connected:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.43v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0v

With charger and battery(machine on):
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.55v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.13v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3v338v

after machine turns on with charger, it can stay powered on until shutdown or power loss

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: When you power on the machine with the charger and battery plugged if you boot into the OS, does it recongize the battery or is there an X through the battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: It does indeed recognize it and it charges it normally.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: Ok how are you turning it on with just the battery I would assume keyboard? If so, tried known good keyboard and inspected trackpad for corrosion or damage? If so, my guess would be to check <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: No corrosion detected, I use the power button. Won't work when completed shut down but when it's on it works normally, puts it to sleep, or I can hold to force shut down. Also smc reset works when charger is plugged in or Mac is on

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: What could cause s5 rails to be 0v when only battery is connected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: All kinds of things what is your voltage on PPBUS currently with just the charger and then with the battery and charger?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message:
Charger Only(amber light): 8.56v
Battery(100%) Only: 8.45v(machine off), 8.39v(machine on - after being turned on by charger then disconnecting charger)
Battery(100%) and Charger(green light): 8.56v

I also noticed that when turning on from a completely off state, the machine the fan spins on and off twice before remaining on and chiming the third time(testing out of housing with nothing except battery or charge port connecting and reacts same in housing with everything connected)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: The on off on off on thing is normal for this model. I’m gonna defer to Duke and others because I don’t know why that’s happening tbh and don’t wanna give you any bad information. My only thought is maybe corrosion under the battery connector or the SMC

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: Disconnect trackpad flex cable and connect the battery. Now short the power pads on the board, <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/6 and see if that works.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: Thank you for all your help, I do appreciate the effort

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: Hello Duke, yes it does turn on when shorting <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground with the trackpad disconnected. No reaction when trackpad is connected and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> is shorted. So does this imply the trackpad is bad?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: I tried connecting a new keyboard just to test and it didn't work either so must be trackpad right?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: Yes bad trackpad and/or trackpad flex.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't power on without charger
threads.message: I ordered a new trackpad and flex cable. Confirmed as bad flex, can be marked as solved. Thanks John and Duke.
